job_title: Business Systems Analyst, SAP - IBP and APO
job_description:
• Architecting, designing and delivering robust implementable solutions for complex supply chain requirements using SAP IBP Supply response, Demand Planning, APO SNP Optimization and CTM Techniques.
• Building prototypes and proof of concepts for business requirements and translating them into effective operational solutions.
• Bachelor’s or Masters degree, or equivalent experience in Operations Management, Industrial Engineering, Computer Science, or Business.
• 12+ plus years of relevant work experience architecting, designing and implementing comprehensive supply chain planning solutions using advanced planning tools.
• Envision and architect scalable supply planning solution(s) to meet needs of growing business.
• Hands-on experience with SAP IBP Supply response, SAP APO SNP optimization, or CTM modeling for solving Supply Chain problems.
• Demonstrating process improvement techniques to streamline business process and architect solutions.
• Leading projects to implement new and improve existing functionalities that are already implemented at NVIDIA in SAP APO and IBP.

• Practical experience solving empirical ML problems at scale.
• Expert-level Python skills and proficiency in a leading ML framework (PyTorch, TensorFlow, JAX, etc.
• Collaborative mindset – able to work closely with colleagues from diverse technical backgrounds.
• Applicants must be eligible to live and work in the US without sponsorship.
• Please ensure you meet the required experience before applying.
• Broad fluency across modern ML approaches and architectures.
• Strong mathematical reasoning and ability to think rigorously about data.
• Intellectual curiosity and drive to experiment with new techniques.

• 3–5 years of experience in AI/ML engineering or applied data science.
• Experience with AWS (EC2, S3, Lambda, SageMaker, Step Functions, etc.
• Understanding of financial markets, quantitative research, or commodities trading (preferably base metals).
• Strong software engineering background, including version control (Git), testing, and CI/CD.
• Background in quantitative finance or exposure to commodity trading.
• Experience with reinforcement learning, optimization, or simulation frameworks.
• Strong proficiency in Python (NumPy, Pandas, PyTorch/TensorFlow, LangChain or similar).
• Familiarity with MCP (Model Context Protocol) or similar orchestration frameworks.

• 6+ years of overall software engineering or data science experience, including 4+ years of direct work in AI/ML.
• Hands-on experience with API creation, RAG, vector databases, LLM prompt engineering, and LLM evaluation.
• Excellent problem-solving, communication, and collaboration skills.
• Experience deploying large-scale AI models in production.
• Background in developing scalable systems in enterprise environments.
• Design, develop, and optimize machine learning and NLP solutions, with a focus on LLMs.
• Build and integrate APIs for AI/ML models, including Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) pipelines and vector database solutions.
• Apply LLM prompt engineering and evaluation techniques to improve model accuracy and usability.

• 5+ years of professional experience in computer vision or robotics perception.
• Strong programming skills in Python and C++.
• Hands-on experience with image processing, 3D reconstruction, and feature extraction techniques.
• Experience with visual SLAM, semantic segmentation, or deep learning-based perception.
• Bachelor’s or master’s in computer science, Electrical Engineering, Robotics, or related field.
• Familiarity with sensor calibration and data synchronization methods.
• Understanding of camera models, multi-view geometry, and point cloud processing.
• Knowledge of stereo vision, depth sensing, or multi-spectral imaging.

• Experience with public cloud infrastructure (e.
• Interest in AI/ML (direct experience not required).
• Advancing the state of the art in applying LLMs/AI to real-world program analysis, vulnerability analysis, reverse engineering, and secure development problems.
• Designing experiments, benchmarks, and evaluation datasets to measure security efficacy, model robustness, and operator workflow impact.
• Building research prototypes and iterating them into reliable, secure, user-ready product capabilities.
• Partnering with internal and external researchers, teams, and design partners to understand high-value opportunities and use cases.
• Collecting and structuring security data (code, vulnerability data, logs, alerts) for performance benchmarking, model training, fine-tuning, and retrieval workflows.

• Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, Electrical Engineering, or a related field.
• 2+ years of experience in AI/ML development, preferably in the consumer electronics or IoT industry.
• Experience with AI/ML frameworks such as PyTorch, or scikit-learn.
• Strong background in computer vision, deep learning, LLM, or reinforcement learning.
• Experience with embedded AI and edge computing frameworks (e.
• Strong problem-solving skills and ability to work in a fast-paced, collaborative environment.
